paper.title: Phase-curve Evidence for an Atmosphere on TRAPPIST-1 b

core_question: Does TRAPPIST-1 b retain an atmosphere despite strong stellar irradiation?

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Observed system
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Phase-resolved thermal spectra of the rocky exoplanet TRAPPIST-1 b.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: No-atmosphere model
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Bare-rock, no-atmosphere scenario with minimal heat redistribution.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: CO2-rich atmosphere scenario
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Atmosphere model featuring significant CO2 absorption in the 15 µm band.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: O2-rich atmosphere scenario
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Oxidized atmospheric composition with weaker CO2 signature constraints.

major_limitations: Single-planet study limits generalizability across M‑dwarf rocky worlds.
Retrieval assumptions (circulation, clouds, opacity priors) affect quantitative posteriors.
Stellar variability and instrument systematics can bias weak spectral features.
